<FR>Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.<Fr><RF>alms: or, righteousness<Rf><RF>of your: or, with your<Rf>

<FR>Therefore when thou doest <FI>thine<Fi> alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.<Fr><RF>do notâ€¦: or, cause not a trumpet to be sounded<Rf>
<FR>But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:<Fr>
<FR>That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.<Fr><CM>

<FR>And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites <FI>are<Fi>: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.<Fr>
<FR>But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.<Fr>
<FR>But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen <FI>do<Fi>: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.<Fr>
<FR>Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.<Fr><CM>
<FR>After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.<Fr>
<FR>Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as <FI>it is<Fi> in heaven.<Fr>
<FR>Give us this day our daily bread.<Fr>
<FR>And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.<Fr>
<FR>And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.<Fr>
<FR>For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:<Fr>
<FR>But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.<Fr><CM>
<FR>Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.<Fr>
<FR>But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;<Fr>
<FR>That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.<Fr><CM>
<FR>Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:<Fr>
<FR>But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:<Fr>
<FR>For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.<Fr>
<FR>The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.<Fr>
<FR>But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great <FI>is<Fi> that darkness!<Fr>
<FR>No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.<Fr><CM>

<FR>Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?<Fr>
<FR>Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?<Fr>
<FR> Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?<Fr>
<FR>And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:<Fr>
<FR>And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.<Fr>
<FR>Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, <FI>shall he<Fi> not much more <FI>clothe<Fi> you, O ye of little faith?<Fr>
<FR>Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?<Fr>
<FR>(For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.<Fr>
<FR>But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.<Fr>
<FR>Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day <FI>is<Fi> the evil thereof.<Fr><CM>
